required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Acute and Chronic Effects of Dynamic Apnea in Healthy Untrained Subjects
clinical_study.official_title: Acute and Chronic Effects of Dynamic Apnea in Healthy Untrained Subjects

collaborator.agency: Laboratoire de Complexité, Innovation et Activités Motrices et Sportives

brief_summary.textblock:
The inclusion of short periods of apnea (several seconds) during exercise (i.e. dynamic apnea) induces a significant decrease in blood oxygenation and muscle tissue. To date, the immediate effects ("acute apnea") of this decrease in the quantity of oxygen available at the muscle and brain level are poorly understood. Moreover, a physical training during which these short periods of apnea ("chronic apnea") would be included could lead to physiological adaptations and to improvement in physical performance similar to those obtained during altitude training.
The purpose of this study is to evaluate the effects of acute dynamic apnea on metabolism.

primary_outcome.measure: Wingate test to measure maximum consumption of dioxygen
Jaeger debimeter system to measure of peak oxygen
Measurement of arterial saturation in dioxygen
Jaeger debimeter system to measure of peak oxygen
Measurement of arterial saturation in dioxygen

secondary_outcome.measure: Borg scale to measure penibility of the effort
Borg scale to measure penibility of the effort

arm_group.description: Program of training with exercises including apneas
Program of training with exercises without apnea

intervention.intervention_name: Program of training with exercises including apnea
intervention.description: 16 training session on cycle ergometry with exercises including apneas.

intervention.intervention_name: Program of training with exercises without apnea
intervention.description: 16 training session on cycle ergometry with exercises without apnea

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- The cutaneous thickness at the vastus lateralis level lower than 1.5 cm to obtain the reliable muscle oxygenation measurement
- Subjects will have to sign the inform consent before the beginning of the study
Exclusion Criteria:
- Contraindications to regular physical exercise practice
- To practice an endurance sport more than 1h/week
- Regular practice of apnea
- Chronic use of cannabis and/or alcohol
- Cardiac or metabolic pathology
- Asthma and/or bronchodilatator treatment
- ECG abnormality at rest
- Regular consumption of tobacco

reference.citation: Andersson JP, Linér MH, Rünow E, Schagatay EK. Diving response and arterial oxygen saturation during apnea and exercise in breath-hold divers. J Appl Physiol (1985). 2002 Sep;93(3):882-6.

Caquelard F, Burnet H, Tagliarini F, Cauchy E, Richalet JP, Jammes Y. Effects of prolonged hypobaric hypoxia on human skeletal muscle function and electromyographic events. Clin Sci (Lond). 2000 Mar;98(3):329-37.
de Bruijn R, Richardson M, Schagatay E. Increased erythropoietin concentration after repeated apneas in humans. Eur J Appl Physiol. 2008 Mar;102(5):609-13. Epub 2007 Dec 19.

Dufour SP, Ponsot E, Zoll J, Doutreleau S, Lonsdorfer-Wolf E, Geny B, Lampert E, Flück M, Hoppeler H, Billat V, Mettauer B, Richard R, Lonsdorfer J. Exercise training in normobaric hypoxia in endurance runners. I. Improvement in aerobic performance capacity. J Appl Physiol (1985). 2006 Apr;100(4):1238-48.
